summary: Removes many rocks, trees, driftwood, plants, shrubs, clutter, and many similar objects amounting by the thousands while still leaving the impression that nothing of value was lost.
descriptionHtml:
[b]OPERATION ROCKSHAVE - WIP[/b]

This mod is specially intended for people who insist to use their office laptops built with weaker integrated video cards for gaming.
Because this mod will remove thousands of unnoticeable objects in the exteriors of Skyrim, less objects will be rendered, less VRAM
will be used, and performance will improve -- by how much depends on the user's mods setup and computer.

[b]v1.0: Covers the entire Whiterun Hold and extends to the following boundaries at the mods current progress:[/b]

Hillgrund's Tomb to the East:
North: Eldersblood Peak
West: Robber's Gorge, Fort Sungard
East: Hillgrund's Tomb, Whitewatch Tower
South: Moss Mother Cavern
Towns, Cities, and other Settlements: These were left untouched.

Operation Rockshave works using two methods:

1. Individually removes a number of rocks, trees, plants, shrubs, wood, and other similar objects that clutter the landscape of Skyrim
which when combined amounts to more than 1k edits and counting. While this may seem like the mod is taking away more from the already desolate
land of Skyrim, in fact, it is still hardly noticeable even to the eagle-eyed player. Good land textures and dense grasses will cover up
what is removed anyway. Even more attention was put on which trees to remove so that they just don't pop up as you approach an area and users do not have to reconfigure their LOD anymore.

2. For objects that I am sure I would not want to see in my game anymore because they look undesirable and only the highest quality mesh and
textures mod can save them, they were removed from the game by redirecting their base ID to a blank mesh. These objects are the following:
 
 A. TreeDeadShrub
 B. TreeDeadShrubSnow
 C. TreeThicket01
 D. TreeThicket01Snow
 E. TreeReachFern03
 F. TreeReachMntMossCover01
 G. TreeReachMntMossCover02
 H. TreeReachMntMossCover03
 I. TreeReachMntMossCover04
 J. TreeReachMntMossCover05
 K. TundraScrub01
 L. TundraScrub02
 M. TundraScrub03
 N. TreeReachBranchPile02
 
Underwater grasses, kelps, and other such flora were not editted as it is assumed the user's grass mod already takes care of this.

Because several thousand objects are not rendered by the game anymore, this would in theory, save you some VRAMThese measures may look extreme and some may call it desperate but I am of the belief that less is always more and one of the keys to make Skyrim look nice is proper placement of these objects which unfortunately has turned to a scattered mess in the landscape of Skyrim -- as if a devastating tropical storm of the century has wrecked havoc and no one has lived in the province since. I had a lot of fun working on this mod as I have discovered chests and strongboxes I have never seen before in all my years of playing Skyrim intermittently. I could have had an easier time if all the weather mods out there didn't have unrealistic rains and thunderstorms so unreal and too long not even tropical countries at their worst rainy season get to have them. I shake my head! I also found some USLEEP-placed objects but I left those alone as they were placed to conceal badly placed objects.

I intend to cover all of Skyrim eventually as fast as humanely possible. If you find any seams or bad edits please inform me on the comments section, thank you.

MOD COMPATIBILITY:
This mod works by going through each individual object's form ID and redirecting its base ID to one that is a blank nif file. It should be
100% compatible with any mod that edits the worldspace. Even if, by off-chance, the same objects are being handled by a different mod, the load
order will decide which to ultimately load in the game so it is up to the player where he/she wants to place this esp on his load order.

SSE COMPATIBILITY:
I'll be honest I haven't touched SSE at all so I don't really know for sure, but since I am editting base IDs, a simple conversion of this mod
using some tool [I don't know any SSE tool] out there should do it.
